body: Tom Calderon succeeds his brother Charles to represent State Assembly District 58.
title: Tom Calderon elected to Assembly

body: Ron Calderon is elected to the 58th district assembly seat, which was vacated by his brother Tom Calderon in order to run for insurance commissioner.
title: Ron Calderon elected to California Assembly

body: Tom Calderon, the brother of Senator Ron Calderon, receives a lucrative contract as a consultant for the Central Basin Water Board, where he's reportedly paid $10,000 per month to advise the district.
title: Tom Calderon is hired as a consultant for the Central Basin Water District

body: Ron Calderon is elected to represent a large portion of eastern L.A. County, including the cities of Bell, Montebello, Commerce, Cudahy, Huntington Park, La Mirada, and a portion of Los Angeles
title: Ron Calderon elected to State Senate
caption: Ronald S. Calderon is the state senator representing Bell, Bell Gardens, Commerce, Cudahy, Huntington Park, La Mirada, Los Angeles, Montebello, Norwalk, Pico Rivera, Santa Fe Springs, South El Monte, South Gate, Whittier, East La Mirada, East Los Angeles, Florence-Graham, Hacienda Heights, South Whittier and West Whittier.

body: The bill would have increased the minimum reporting requirement from $5,000 to $7,000. Calderon withdraws it after the chairman of the Fair Political Practices Commission urges Gov. Schwarzenegger to veto it, noting that if a legislator donates money, it should be reported.
title: Ron Calderon backs bill to ease restrictions on legislator-directed donations to charities
caption: State Sen. Ron Calderon, left, smiles as he walks through the Capitol with his brother, former assemblyman Charles Calderon, D-Whittier.

body: The FBI begins an investigation into Ron, Tom and Charles Calderon after receiving information from the Fair Political Practices Commission. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: FBI investigates Calderons

body: The FBI in Los Angeles joins another undercover investigation in Sacramento. Two undercover FBI agents pose as venture capitalists and meet with Ron and Tom Calderon. No are bribes solicited or accepted. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: FBI meets Ron, Tom Calderon

body: Ron Calderon makes the first of three donations, totaling $6,000, to candidates running for the Central Basin board. The money comes from his 2010 senate campaign fund. Two of the recipients, Art Chacon and Phillip Hawkins, remain on the board.
title: Calderon makes donations to water board candidates
caption: Central Basin Water District board members Art Chacon (L) and Phillip D. Hawkins both received donations from Ron Calderon in 2008.

body: Calderon is tapped to head the influential Senate Banking Finance and Insurance Committee. The committee oversees legislation affecting financial and insurance institutions, commerce, international trade, retail credit interest rates and corporations.
title: Ron Calderon becomes chair of Senate banking and insurance committee

body: U.S. Rep. Grace Napolitano calls for an investigation into a hike in water rates and an audit of the Central Basin Water District's spending. The district was never investigated despite, she says, Ron Calderon's assurances it would be. Napolitano told the LA Times she believes Calderon thwarted the attempt.
title: Congresswoman's calls for investigation of water district allegedly thwarted

body: A Central Basin Municipal Water District committee recommends a $1 million grant for EcoGreen, a Southern California environmental firm. But the board instead decides to award the contract to The Steelworkers Oldtimers Foundation, a nonprofit founded by former Bell mayor George Cole. Tom Calderon is a former president of the organization. EcoGreen exec Michael Francheck alleges cronyism.
title: Allegations of cronyism: Central Basin Water District's contract with Oldtimers Foundation

body: The Central Basin Municipal Water District district is awarded a $1 million federal research grant to work with HydroEarth, a local water management firm. But the project takes a turn when the district amends the grant and reopens the contract for bidding. The contract is instead awarded to another water management firm, Water2Save. HydroEarth executives allege the move was made because Tom Calderon is a Water2Save board member.
title: Allegations of cronyism: Central Basin Water District's contract with Water2Save

body: Calderon is unanimously elected vice-chair of the 23-member Latino Legislative Caucus, replacing Tony Mendoza, who moved up to chair the organization.
title: Ron Calderon becomes Vice Chair of Latino Legislative Caucus

body: Calderon introduces SB701, a bill that would have extended the reach of the Central Basin water district's authority. The bill never received a hearing in the senate.
title: Ron Calderon introduces bill that would grant more authority to water district

body: FBI initiates undercover investigation targeting two other politicians in LA. An undercover agent is introduced to Ron Calderon. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: FBI investigates other LA politicians

body: The FBI's undercover agent presents himself as a Hollywood executive from a film studio. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Agent poses as studio executive

body: Ron Calderon and the undercover agent have lunch in Los Angeles. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Ron Calderon meets the FBI for lunch

body: Ron Calderon sents a text message to the undercover agent. “Great lunch! Thanks. Here is my cell! I am emailing u next.” (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Ron Calderon texts with FBI agent

body: FBI adds Ron Calderon as a subject of its investigation. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: FBI adds Ron Calderon to investigation

body: The undercover agent and Ron Calderon have dinner in Pico Rivera. Ron asks the agent, who is posing as a film executive, to give his daughter a job. “I told you man, anything you can do any help you could do for my kids is, is – you know that’s, that’s diamonds for me. That’s diamonds." (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Dinner with the FBI

body: Ron Calderon says he's willing to hire the agent's girlfriend, who is actually an undercover FBI agent, to work in his office. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: A job with Ron Calderon

body: The agent and Ron Calderon have breakfast in Montebello. Calderon says he can introduce an amendment on film tax credits to benefit the agent. Calderon also offers to write up contract so his daughter can work for the film studio. “Ronald Calderon told the [undercover agent] it was ‘better to keep it legit.’” He then tells the agent to mail him his daughter’s first paycheck. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Ron Calderon asks for a job -- for his daughter

body: Ron Calderon emails agent, “Didn’t receive anything yesterday FYI.”  (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Ron Calderon: where's the money?

body: The agent and Ron Calderon meet at the agent’s apartment in downtown to talk about Calderon’s daughter and the tax credit legislation. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: A meeting in downtown

body: Ron Calderon and his son visit the agent at his film studio. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Calderon visits the studio

body: The undercover agent calls Ron Calderon to get his home address. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Feds ask Calderon for address

body: Agent mails Jessica Calderon's first "paycheck." "Package received. Ty," Ron Calderon writes in an email. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: First check sent for Jessica Calderon

body: Ron Calderon and his wife, Ana, attend the Imagen Awards at the Beverly Hilton hotel with the agent and another undercover agent posing as his girlfriend. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Imagen Awards

body: Ron Calderon votes against a bill sponsored by state Sen. Alan Lowenthal that gives the Water Replenishment District of Southern California authority over groundwater reserves in the region. The bill passed 30-4 in the Senate and was signed into law by Governor Brown.
title: Calderon opposes bill to give authority over groundwater management to neighboring district
caption: Sen. Alan Lowenthal sponsored SB 1386, which Calderon opposed.

body: Ron Calderon emails the agent to say, "We were just thrown a curveball." The Legislative Counsel determines Calderon's amend on film tax credits needs a two-thirds vote. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Problem with Calderon's tax amendment

body: The agent and Ron Calderon have a conversation about keeping the film tax credit issue alive. Of Senate President Pro Tem Darrell Steinberg, Calderon says, "I helped him, he helped me ... It was important to me. I did something that I knew was important to him. It is all about relationships." (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Calderon talks about Steinberg

body: Ron Calderon emails the FBI agent, asking "should Jessica expect a check this month." (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Calderon: where's the money?

body: The agent and Ron Calderon have dinner in Pico Rivera. Ron Calderon agrees to write a letter in support of the tax credit legislation. According to the affidavit, "Ronald Calderon told the UC it would be fine for them to make up an association or commission, so long as they were the ones to whom the letter was addressed." (Via affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Ron Calderon makes up a film commission

body: Ron Calderon makes up the United Pacific Independent Producers of California. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: United Pacific Independent Producers of California

body: The undercover agent mails a $3,000 check with Jessica Calderon's name on it to Ron Calderon's home in Montebello. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Jessica Calderon's check goes to her dad

body: Judge Paul L. Abrams allows the government to search Calderon’s AOL email account. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Feds look into Calderon's emails

body: The agent has dinner with Ron and Tom Calderon. Ron Calderon says state Sen. Kevin de Leon was supposed to join them. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Dinner with the Calderons

body: Ron Calderon asks the agent to give Jessica Calderon something to do to legitimize the arrangement. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Ron Calderon asks for work for his daughter

body: Ron Calderon tells the agent it's important to have a good relationship with de Leon. He says, "Senator de Leon could be extremely helpful in getting Ronald Calderon several appointments, such as an appointment to the Unemployment Board of the Board of Equalization." (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Ron Calderon talks about de Leon

body: The FBI agent meets Ron Calderon and Kevin de Leon for dinner in downtown Los Angeles. They discuss film tax credits. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Dinner with de Leon

body: Jessica Calderon emails the agent about helping him get a liquor license for his studio. This is not something the agent ever discussed with her. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Jessica Calderon emails FBI agent

body: Ron Calderon emails the agent to ask if he's had any luck arranging a trip to Las Vegas for Halloween. The agent reponds that he's booked a VIP table at Bank. "Nelly is hosting/performing and you've got a front row seat on the action!" (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Halloween in Las Vegas

body: Ron Calderon emails the agent a picture of himself with rappers Nelly and T.I. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Calderon emails photos from Halloween

body: The agent hands Ron Calderon a $3,000 check for his daughter. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Another check for Jessica Calderon

body: Ron Calderon asks for a $5,000 check to cover his son's tuition at the Berklee College of Music. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Money for Zach Calderon's tuition

body: At a dinner, Ron Calderon receives another $3,000 check for his daughter. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Another check to Ron Calderon

body: Ron Calderon suggests the agent donate $10,000 to Kevin de Leon's fundraiser that will be held in connection with the Manny Paquiao fight in Las Vegas. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Fundraiser for de Leon

body: Ron Calderon tells the agent that Kevin de Leon made him a deal not to run as chair of the Latino Caucus. According to Calderon, de Leon will give him a paid political appointment when he leaves office, give him his own fundraiser, and give him $25,000 to hire consultants. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Ron Calderon talks more about de Leon

body: Ron Caldeorn gives the agent a box of cigars and a coffee maker as gifts for the holidays. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Christmas gifts for the FBI

body: The FBI office in Sacramento ends its investigation. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: FBI Sacramento closes investigation

body: Ron Calderon invites the agent to a Lady Gaga concert fundraiser benefitting his 2014 campaign for controller and state Sen. Ricardo Lara's 2016 race. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Lady Gaga Concert Fundraiser

body: The undercover agent is given an invoice for $25,000 for Californains for Diversity. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Money for Californians for Diversity

body: Judge Audrey B. Collins allows the feds to intercept wire and electronic communications from Ron Calderon's cell phone. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: FBI listens to Calderon's phone calls

body: Ron Calderon asks the agent to write a $3,200 check to his officeholder account so he can buy a plane ticket to Miami. A day later, the agent mails him the check. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Money for Miami

body: Judge Abrams authorizes a follow up search of the AOL email account and a search of Ron Calderon's iCloud emails. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: FBI looks at more emails

body: Ron and Tom Calderon fly to Miami to meet with a third undercover agent who is posing as an investor in the film studio. They talk to him about hiring Tom Calderon as a consultant. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: A trip to Miami

body: This third undercover agent and the Calderons agree to pay Tom Calderon's consulting fee through Californians for Diversity. When the agent drops off Ron Calderon at the airport, he hands him an envelope containing $3,000 in cash. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Californians for Diversity and an envelope of cash

body: Judge Jean P. Rosennbluth authoraizes search for information on Michael Drobot of Pacific Hospital in Long Beach. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Feds investigate Pacific Hospital

body: Judge Collins renews order to tap Calderon's cell.(Via affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: More taps on Calderon's phone

body: Affidavit to search Calderon's office is signed. (Via FBI affidavit published by Al Jazeera America)
title: Feds get affidavit to search

body: L.A. State Sen. Ron Calderon's offices in the state capitol and at the Legislative Office Building in Sacramento are raided by FBI agents. Several agents left the Capitol more than six hours later carrying at least a half-dozen boxes, stuffed black bags and what appeared to be a computer hard drive. Calderon's denies any wrongdoing.
title: Ron Calderon's offices raided by FBI

body: Documents are sought from the Central Basin Municipal Water District just days after the offices of State Senator Ron Calderon were raided by FBI agents.
title: Feds subpoenaed records from Commerce-based water district after FBI raided Calderon's office
caption: State Senator Ron Calderon helped open the Central Basin Municipal Water District's new headquarters in 2008.

body: Tom and Charles Calderon have fundraising committees, but their plans may be affected by an FBI investigation into Ron Calderon, who's eyeing a return to the Assembly.
title: Calderon brothers raise funds for 2014 campaigns
caption: State Sen. Ron Calderon, left, has been raising money for a return to the Assembly in 2014. He's seen here with his brother, former Assemblyman Charles Calderon, who has a committee for a Secretary of State campaign. A third brother, Tom, may seek Ron's current Senate seat. (Rich Pedroncelli/AP)

body: Former assemblyman Tom Calderon denies any wrongdoing and says he has "no idea" what FBI agents were searching for in a raid of his brother's legislative offices.
title: Tom Calderon: 'No idea' why Sen. Ron Calderon's offices were raided by FBI
caption: An FBI agent carries out a box as he leaves the Capitol office of State Sen. Ron Calderon, D-Montebello, in Sacramento, Calif., Tuesday, June 4, 2013. (Rich Pedroncelli/AP)

body: The political consultant made campaign donations to board members who approved his contracts. It's not illegal, but some observers say it doesn't look good.
title: Tracking the money flow between Central Basin Water District and Tom Calderon
caption: The offices of the Central Basin Municipal Water District in Los Angeles County are seen in Commerce, Calif., in a Wednesday, June 12, 2013 photo. The state has hundreds of local water districts, which often deal with millions of dollars but operate as quasi-government entities with very little oversight or public scrutiny. (Damian Dovarganes/AP)

body: A water district that figures into an FBI investigation of state Senator Ron Calderon says it is suing a contractor for overbilling it nearly $1 million.
title: Water District at center of Calderon investigation sues contractor for overbilling nearly $1 million

body: The agency, which is part of a federal investigation into State Senator Ron Calderon, alleges $867,000 in over-billing from Pasadena-based Pacifica Services.
title: Central Basin Water District sues vendor as it reviews all finances

body: The federal affidavit alleges Calderon accepted almost $60,000 in bribes from an undercover FBI agent. The FBI, meanwhile, is investigating the leak of a document.
title: Calderon targeted in Hollywood bribery sting; leak under investigation
caption: In this file photo, state Sen. Ron Calderon, D-Montebello, whose violence-awareness measure was approved by the Senate, talks with seat mate Ben Hueso, D-San Diego, in Sacramento, Calif. The FBI searched the offices of Calderon on Tuesday, June 4, 2013, but would not disclose the reason for the investigation. (Rich Pedroncelli/AP)

body: The California State Senate leader says he'll be 'damned' if he doesn't do all he can to avoid having the case 'taint' the legislature.
title: Calderon investigation update: Steinberg says he's protecting the public, Latino Caucus under scrutiny

body: California's Senate Rules Committee acted amid a federal investigation. On Wednesday, a group of elected officials from Southeast L.A. will call for Calderon's resignation.
title: California lawmakers remove embattled state Sen. Calderon from committees

body: Even though State Senator Ron Calderon has not been charged, a group of 15 elected officials from Southeast L.A says his conduct has tarnished the office.
title: Local elected leaders call on Calderon to resign
caption: State Assemblywoman Cristina Garcia, at podium, led a group of Southeast L.A. elected officials who are calling for State Senator Ron Calderon to resign. (Frank Stoltze/KPCC)

body: The Fair Political Practices Commission seeks clarity on a donation made by a PAC run by the Latino Caucus to a nonprofit tied to Ron and Tom Calderon.
title: California state commission investigates donation to Calderon nonprofit
caption: The names of state senators Kevin De Leon, left, and Ricardo Lara, right, surfaced in an affidavit regarding an investigation into their senate colleague Ron Calderon. They are seen here with Speaker of the Assembly John Pérez. (Maya Sugarman/KPCC)

body: The State Senate committee retains a prominent legal firm to help dig through the federal investigation into State Sen. Ron Calderon.
title: Calderon: Calif. Ethics Committee hires outside counsel to look into FBI investigation
caption: As the California Legislature reconvenes on Jan. 6, the Senate Ethics Committee is examining the FBI's investigation into State Sen. Ron Calderon. (Justin Sullivan/Getty Images)

body: A 24-count indictment against State Sen. Ron Calderon and his brother, Tom, announced Friday, includes a laundry list of public corruption charges and accuses the Montebello politician of taking tens of thousands of dollars in bribes from a businessman and from undercover agents posing as Hollywood film executives.
title: Calderon, brother indicted on public corruption charges following FBI raid
caption: In this Monday June 10, 2013, file photo, State Sen. Ron Calderon, D-Montebello, left, holds a brief news conference during first appearance at the Capitol following and FBI raid of his Sacramento offices. On Friday, Feb. 21, 2014, federal authorities indicted Calderon on corruption charges. (Rich Pedroncelli/AP)

body: Ron Calderon turns himself in to federal authorities. He pleads not guilty to charges of corruption and money laundering and is released in lieu of $50,000 bail. California Senate President Pro Tem Darrell Steinberg says Calderon would be given a week to resign or take a leave of absence before the senate moves ahead with a vote to suspend him.
title: State Sen. Ron Calderon surrenders on corruption, money laundering charges; pleads 'not guilty'
caption: Mark Geragos, attorney for State Senator Ron Calderon, says his client "is in relatively good spirits, given the situation. It's obviously a very trying situation for him."
